dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2288 IH: Common Sense Air Regulations Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Georgia (for himself, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Pfluger, and Mr. Weber of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To nullify the final rule of the Environmental Protection Agency titled Reconsideration of the National Ambient Air Quality Standards for Particulate Matter.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Common Sense Air Regulations Act.

section.header: Nullification of final rule relating to Reconsideration of the National Ambient Air Quality Standards for Particulate Matter
section.text: The final rule of the Environmental Protection Agency titled Reconsideration of the National Ambient Air Quality Standards for Particulate Matter (89 Fed. Reg. 16202 (March 6, 2024)) shall have no force or effect.
